conversation.text: Hi. If you are ready Preheat the oven to 204C. Get a baking dish and line with 1tbsp of oil or butter and place the baking paper on top.
evidence: Preheat the oven and prepare the dish

conversation.text: My oven shows Fahrenheit. How many degrees Fahrenheit is that?
Forfarenheit it's 400. Let me know when you are ready for the next step
Sure. Just for your information, I have 4 chicken breasts.
That's fine. You can bake as many as you want but just make sure they fit in the dish without touching. You may need more than one
evidence: You can bake as many chicken breasts as you need with this method. Ensure that they'll fit in the pan without touching.

conversation.text: I'm ready for the next step.
Pat the chicken breasts dry with paper towel. spread over some oil or butter and season with salt and pepper. You can add additional seasoning for extra flavour, like rosemary
evidence: Take a paper towel and pat two boneless, skinless chicken breasts dry. Spread a little of the butter or oil over the chicken,

conversation.text: How much salt should I add?
Sprinkle a little salt, you can always add more later
evidence: Sprinkle some salt and pepper over the chicken

conversation.text: Hmmm that's too vague for me. I don't have much experience. Will 1 tablespoon be enough?
A pinch or 1/4 of a tsp
Thanks. What's next?
Cut a sheet of paper parchment to fit the disk. Using 1 tbsp of butter and butter one side of the paper and cover the chicken, pressing butter side down
evidence: Press the buttered parchment on the chicken

conversation.text: What should I after that?
Place it in the preheated oven and bake for 20 minutes on the middle shelf
What else should I do?

After the 20 minutes check the temperature by inserting a instant-reader thermometer into the thick part of the chicken. If it reads 165F you can remove it from the oven. If not, or if you don't have a thermometer - cook for another 20 minutes.
evidence: Check the temperature and bake the chicken for 10 to 20 more minutes

conversation.text: I don't have a thermometer. Is there any other way I can check?
Slice the chicken where it's thickest - if it's white it's cooked. If it's still pink cook for another 20 minutes.
That's a good idea. Thanks!
When it's cooked you can serve or store then for up to one week in an air tight container. Let me know if you have any other questions
Are we done?
Yep

recipe.title: How to Cook Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts

procedure.summary: Preheat the oven and prepare the dish.
procedure.description: Turn on the oven to 400 °F (204 °C). Get out a baking dish and a sheet of parchment paper. Rub the inside and bottom of the dish with 1 tablespoon of butter or oil. You should also coat one side of the parchment paper with butter or oil. Set the dish and paper aside.

procedure.summary: Season the chicken and place it in the dish.
procedure.description: Take a paper towel and pat two boneless, skinless chicken breasts dry. Spread a little of the butter or oil over the chicken, if you like. Sprinkle some salt and pepper over the chicken breasts and set them into the prepared dish. The chicken shouldn't touch. You can use your favorite seasoning to add extra flavor. For example, set sprigs of fresh rosemary or sliced lemon around the chicken. You can bake as many chicken breasts as you need with this method. Ensure that they'll fit in the pan without touching.

procedure.summary: Press the buttered parchment on the chicken.
procedure.description: Place the buttered side of the parchment paper directly onto the seasoned chicken breasts. Push the sides of the paper down into the pan and around the meat. You should try to completely cover the chicken so it doesn't dry out as it bakes.
Put the dish of chicken in the preheated oven. Set it on the middle rack so it cooks evenly.

procedure.summary: Check the temperature and bake the chicken for 10 to 20 more minutes.
procedure.description: Insert an instant-read thermometer into the thickest part of a chicken breast to check the temperature. If it reads at least 165 °F (74 °C), you can take it out of the oven. If it hasn't, cook the chicken for 10 to 20 more minutes until it reaches temperature.

Remove the chicken from the oven and peel off the parchment paper. You can serve the cooked chicken breasts, slice them to use in a recipe, or store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator. You can store the cooked chicken breasts for up to one week.
